Tea Tech Tips

Heat during processing of leaf is detrimental to the quality of the
product. Process leaf during the early hours of the day, take other
measures such as humidifiers, wet curtains in the rolling and
fermenting areas.

Crop & Weather (For the period 23rd- 29th July 2025)

The Western and Nuwara Eliya planting districts experienced rain
throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology forecast showers
to be expected in both regions.

Uva/Udapussellawa's experienced sunny conditions. Thunder showers
are to be expected in both districts.

Low growns reported sunny mornings followed by occasional evening
showers. Scattered showers are to be expected in the Low grown
districts.

All regions reported a decline in their crop intakes except for the
Nuwara Eliya's which recorded an increase.

This Week's Market Movement at Colombo Tea Auction

Order of Sale this week

Demand: Ex-Estate met with lower demand. Firm demand prevailed for Low Growns.

High Grown Teas

BOP - Best Westerns were irregular and easier by Rs. 50/- per kg and
more. In the Below Best category, a few invoices held firm, whilst others
were irregular. Teas at the lower end were firm to lower by Rs.20/- per
kg. Uda Pussellawa’s were irregularly easier and mostly unsold. Nuwara
Eliya’s were mostly unsold. Seasonal Uva’s sold well between Rs.
2000-3000/- per kg range, whilst others were barely steady.

 

BOPF - Best Westerns few selected invoices held firm, whilst others
declined by Rs.20-40/- per kg or more. Below Best were firm to lower
by Rs.20-40/- per kg. Teas at the lower end eased by Rs.20-30/- per kg.
Uda Pussellawa’s were irregular and easier. Nuwara Eliya’s were mostly
unsold. Seasonal Uva’s sold well between Rs. 2000-2250/- per kg,
whilst others declined by Rs. 50/- per kg.

Medium Grown Teas

BOP1 - Select best moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg whilst all others held
firm.

OP1 - Select best maintained. Best were lower by Rs. 50/- per kg.
Below best and others remained unchanged.

PEK -  Select best appreciated by Rs. 50/- per kg. Best gained by Rs.
20/- per kg. Below best and others held firm.

PEK1 - Select best moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg. Best gained by Rs.
150/-per kg. Below best were dearer by Rs. 100/- per kg whilst others
appreciated by Rs. 50/- per kg

OP/OPA - Select best lost by Rs. 50/- per kg. Best and below best
moved up by Rs. 20/- per kg. Others held firm.

FBOP- Select best were dearer by Rs. 50/- per kg whilst all others
maintained.

FBOPF1 - Select best held firm. Best and below best moved up by Rs.
50/- per kg whilst others remained unchanged.

CTC Teas

HIGH GROWN

BP1s - Hardly any offerings.

PF1s - Better sorts were firm, whilst the others were irregular.

 

MEDIUM GROWN

BP1s - Irregular.

PF1s - Better sorts were generally firm, whilst the others tended
marginally easier.

 

LOW GROWN

BP1s - Select invoices were dearer, whilst the others were barely
steady.

PF1s - Better teas were firm and marginally dearer, whilst the
secondary types were marginally easier.

Low Grown Teas

BOP1 - Select best and best were firm, whilst best and poorer sorts
were irregular.

OP1 - Select best and best were firm whilst below best and poorer
sorts were firm to dearer.

OP/OPA  - Select best and best were firm to dearer. Below best and
poorer sorts were irregular.

PEKOE/PEKOE1 - Select best PEK's were firm, whilst best and below
best were firm to dearer. Select best and best PEK1's were firm whilst
best and below best were firm to dearer.

FBOP/FBOP1 - Select best and best were firm, whilst others were
dearer.

BOP - All round held firm.

BOPF - All-round held firm.

FBOPF/FBOPF1 - All around FBOPF’s were firm to dearer. Select best
and best FBOPF1's were firm, whilst others were firm to dearer.

Off Grades

FGS/FGS1 - High growns were firm to Rs. 20-40/- per kg dearer.
Medium and low growns were easier by Rs. 10-20/- per kg. CTC's were
lower by Rs. 20-40/- per kg.

BM - Cleaner varieties were firm to Rs. 10-20/- per kg dearer. Below
best and bottom were lower by Rs. 20-30/- per kg.

BP -  In general eased by Rs. 20-40/- per kg.

BOP1A - Select best were firm. Below Best were firm to lower by
Rs.20-30/- per kg and more, whilst the poorer sorts held firm.

DUST Grades

DUST1 - Best and below best were irregularly lower. CTC’s maintained.
Best low growns appreciated by Rs. 20-40/- per kg. Below best low
growns maintained.


DUST - Cleaner secondaries irregular and Low growns maintained.

Other Markets

Mombasa Auction of 28th / 29th July 2025

There was good general demand for the 186,120 packages
(12,632,701.00 kilos) available in the market; 45.26% remained unsold.

 

Pakistan Packers were active while Yemen and other Middle Eastern
countries lent strong support. There was reduced activity from
Kazakhstan and other CIS states with maintained enquiry from
Afghanistan and Bazaar. Egyptian Packers showed more and strong
interest with UK active but selective; Russia improved absorption.
Sudan were absent while South Sudan maintained activity. Local
Packers reduced interest while Somalia were active at the lower end of
the market.

 

LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)

 

BP1: Best – Irregular enquiry and varied between USC29 dearer to
easier by up to USC18 with most teas remaining unsold. Brighter – Saw
irregular interest and ranged between steady to USC20 dearer to easier
by up to USC27. Mediums – KTDA mediums were firm to USC10 dearer
to USC8 below previous levels with plantation mediums firm to USC37
dearer for some lines to easier by up to USC20. Lower Medium – More
irregular and ranged between steady to USC16 dearer to easier by up to
USC20. Plainer – Easier by up to USC9 but select teas gained up to
USC6.

 

PF1: Best – More irregular and varied between USC22 above previous
levels to easier by up to USC27. Brighter – Were irregular and ranged
between USC7 dearer to USC12 below last levels. Mediums – KTDA
mediums were firm to USC11 dearer to easier by up to USC10;
Plantation medium were irregular ranging between USC12 dearer to
USC8 below previous rates. Lower Medium – Were firm to USC9 above
previous rates to USC8 easier. Plainer – More irregular interest and
varied between USC4 dearer to mostly easier by up to USC15.

 

DUST GRADES (M1)

 

PDUST: Best – Gained up to USC26 but a few lines were easier by up to
USC6. Brighter – Saw irregular enquiry and varied between USC7 dearer
to mostly easier by up to USC9. Mediums – KTDA mediums were steady
to USC24 above previous levels to USC7 easier with plantation
mediums appreciating by up to USC10. Lower Medium – Were dearer by
up to USC10. Plainer – Mostly gained by up to USC6 but select invoices
lost up to USC8.

 

DUST1: Best – Were up to USC9 dearer to USC16 below previous
levels. Brighter – Irregular ranging between firm to USC8 dearer to
mostly easier by up to USC14. Mediums – KTDA mediums were
irregular and ranged between firm to USC8 above last levels to mostly
easier by up to USC13. Plantation mediums advanced up to USC15 but
select lines were discounted by up to USC3. Lower Medium – Irregular
ranging between firm to USC6 dearer to easier by up to USC5. Plainer –
Were up to USC5 above previous rates to easier by up to USC3.

 

SECONDARY GRADES (S1) In the Secondary Catalogues, BPs were
firm with better made sorts dearer; PFs sold at about previous rates.
Clean well sorted coloury Fannings were steady to dearer while similar
DUSTs were firm with some lines selling above previous levels. Other
Fannings were firm while DUSTs were irregular. BMFs were well
absorbed.

 

(Courtesy - Africa Tea Brokers Ltd)

Jakarta Auction of 25th July 2025

The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 76.43%(1,225,405.47kgs) of
the total offering of 1,603,275.35Kgs.


Demand: Good and improved demand on all sorts except for the lower
medium and plainer teas which continue to meet with selective or
rather reduced demand.

Market: The best, good & better medium teas sold at firm to dearer
prices. Medium sorts stabilized at barely steady levels, except for the
fanning grade which saw a slight decline in prices. Select plain teas
held on to last levels however, bulk of this category especially browner
and fibrous sorts continued to face withdrawals.

Buying Pattern:  Major blenders continued to be the mainstay of the
CTC market with 45.66% off take with fair support from the Western
India packer. Local & regional packers were active on the best and good
liquoring sorts. Internal buyers continued to be subdued. Russian and
CIS exporters along with the Middle east shippers increased their
purchases especially on blacker sorts. Iraqi shippers too were fairly
active.

 

ORTHODOX LEAF

Demand: Fair Demand.

Market: High grown whole leaf with good make and blacker sorts were
firm to dearer. Others were Rs 2 to 3 easier. Medium grown whole leaf
sold irregularly, with cleaner broken ruling firm market. Fanning eased
in value.

Buying Pattern: CIS buyers were selective on cleaner blacker varieties
along with Internal buyers.Middle east shippers lent fair support on
whole leaf grades and broken.

 

CTC DUST

Demand:  Good improved demand. Reduced demand for the lower
medium and plainers..

Market: CTC dust offer this week was at 484,220.66Kgs of which
372464.96kgs were sold (76.92%). Best & good teas sold dearer in line
with quality. Better medium & medium teas sold at fully firm rates.
Select lower medium and plainer teas sold at last levels however the
browner sorts continued to face withdrawals.

Buying Pattern:  Major blenders were fairly active. Regional and local
packers were active on the best & good teas. Up country buyers were
subdued. Exporters to Russia, Middle east improved their purchases
this week on blacker sorts.

 

ORTHODOX DUST

Demand: Good demand.

Market: High grown primary dust fetched irregular prices following
quality, medium grown sold irregularly easier. Secondaries were barely
steady.

Buying Pattern: Regional & local packateers were fairly active on
primary dusts. Exporters were very choosy at steady prices on the
secondary dusts.

 

(Courtesy -J Thomas & Company Private Limited)

Bangladesh Auction of 28th July 2025

CTC LEAF: 53,930 packages of tea on offer continued to meet with a
strong demand.

BROKENS: All good liquoring Brokens were strongly competed for and
prices were fully firm to touch dearer for selective lots. Withdrawals
were negligible in this category. Mediums were firm. Plain descriptions
met with some demand and were about steady but there were several
withdrawals. BLF teas met with a fairly good demand and were
generally firm to occasionally dearer. There were a few withdrawals.

FANNINGS: Best and good Fannings were a strong feature and were
mostly firm whilst Mediums saw a steady demand and prices were also
firm on last. Plain varieties saw less demand there were many more
withdrawals. BLF teas met with a fairly good demand and were
generally firm to occasionally dearer. There were several withdrawals.

 DUST: 13,064 packages of tea on offer met with good demand Good
liquoring Dusts sold well at around last levels Medium and plainer sorts
were discounted and witnessed fair weight of withdrawals. BLFs
continued to meet with a better demand with only a few withdrawals.
Blenders lent strong support with fair interest from the Loose tea
buyers.

COMMENTS: Blenders continued to operate strongly but there was
less support from the Loose tea buyers. Buyers once again followed
quality closely whereby a selection of plainer types were neglected and
were subject to withdrawals. Dusts sold well.

 

(Courtesy - National Brokers Limited)
